skill.name: skill-builder
skill.description: Interactive skill creation assistant that guides users through building new Agent Skills for Claude Code. Use when creating new skills, building custom capabilities, or when the user runs /new-skill command. Helps design skill structure, craft descriptions, create scripts, and organize supporting files.

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based meta-skill with no executable code, no network calls, no file system access, and no external command execution. Contains only documentation and guidance templates for skill creation.

content.user_title: Create Agent Skills for Claude Code
content.value_statement: Building custom Agent Skills for Claude Code requires understanding YAML frontmatter, description best practices, and file structures. This meta-skill guides you through the entire creation process step by step with proven templates and patterns.
actual_capabilities: Guides users through defining skill purpose, use cases, and triggers
Helps craft effective descriptions (max 1024 chars) with proper trigger keywords
Determines optimal skill structure: instruction-based, script-powered, or comprehensive
Creates SKILL.md files with YAML frontmatter following official format
Provides Python and Bash script templates using uv for dependency management
Troubleshoots common skill activation and configuration issues
limitations: Does not execute code or install packages on the user's system
Does not create files directly - guides users on how to create them
Does not access external APIs or services beyond optional documentation lookup
Does not modify existing skills - only assists in creating new ones

use_cases.title: First Skill Creation
use_cases.description: Learn how to create your first Agent Skill with proper structure and descriptions that actually activate.

use_cases.title: Script-Powered Skills
use_cases.description: Build complex skills with Python scripts using uv for dependency management and PEP 723 inline metadata.

use_cases.title: Team-Shared Skills
use_cases.description: Create project-scoped skills that work across your team's repository with consistent patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Create New Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new Agent Skill called [skill-name] that [what it should do]. Use when [when to trigger it].

prompt_templates.title: Fix Skill Activation
prompt_templates.prompt: My skill [skill-name] is not activating when I mention [keywords]. Review my SKILL.md and suggest fixes to the description.

prompt_templates.title: Add Script Support
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me add a Python script to my existing skill [skill-name] that processes [data type] using uv and PEP 723.

prompt_templates.title: Structure Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my skill [skill-name] structure. Does it follow best practices for descriptions, YAML frontmatter, and file organization?

output_examples.input: Help me create a skill called pdf-helper that extracts text from PDF files
output: I'll help you create the pdf-helper skill. Let me ask a few questions:
1. What specific PDF operations should this skill support?
2. What keywords should trigger this skill?
3. Does this need Python scripts or just instructions?
Example description: 'Extract text from PDF files. Use when working with PDF files, .pdf documents, or when user mentions PDF extraction.'

best_practices: Include specific trigger keywords in descriptions like file types, technologies, and user phrases
Use the formula: [Action verbs] + [capabilities] + '. Use when [triggers].' + '[Requires X if needed]'
Keep descriptions under 1024 characters and split complex skills into focused single-purpose skills
anti_patterns: Vague descriptions like 'helps with files' without specific triggers
Creating 'swiss army knife' skills that try to do too many unrelated things
Putting all documentation in SKILL.md instead of using REFERENCE.md for advanced details

faq.question: What is the minimum required for a skill?
faq.answer: A skill needs only a SKILL.md file with name and description in YAML frontmatter. Scripts and REFERENCE.md are optional.

faq.question: How long can skill descriptions be?
faq.answer: Descriptions have a 1024 character limit. Include what the skill does and when users should trigger it.

faq.question: Where should I place new skills?
faq.answer: Personal skills go in ~/.claude/skills/[skill-name]/. Project skills go in .claude/skills/[skill-name]/ or skills/[skill-name]/.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This meta-skill only provides guidance. It does not read, write, or execute code on your system.

faq.question: Why is my skill not activating?
faq.answer: Common causes: description lacks trigger keywords, description too vague, or keywords not in user language. Add specific terms users would actually say.

faq.question: What is the difference between this and other skills?
faq.answer: This is a meta-skill that helps create other skills. It contains no executable code, only instructions and templates for skill development.
